image.alt_text: Photo by Decolonial Clothing in Turtle Island. May be an image of 1 person.
image.caption:
Since we are taking about missing women, there are thousands of missing Indigenous women, girls and Two-Spirit people who have vanished across Turtle Island. 

The statistics below are based on NWAC’s database as of March 31, 2010: 

NWAC has gathered information about 582 cases of missing and murdered Aboriginal women and girls. Of these:

 67% are murder cases (death as the result of homicide or negligence);
 20% are cases of missing women or girls;
 4% are cases of suspicious death—deaths regarded as natural or accidental by police, but considered suspicious by family or community members; and
 9% are cases where the nature of the case is unknown—it is unclear whether the woman was murdered, is missing or died in suspicious circumstances.

We send our condolences, smoke and prayers to the family of Gabby Petito because we know all too well what it feels like to have a loved one stolen from us. 

We ask that the public and police give Indigenous women, girls, Two-Spirit and Women of Color the same urgency and energy when we go missing as well. 

Customer photo by @notyourmascot.rhs 

Wearing JUSTICE FOR INDIGENOUS

image.alt_text: Photo by Tina Powell in Saskatchewan, Canada. May be an image of 4 people, people standing and text that says 'CANADIAN WOMEN WHO ROCK WOMEN WHO ROCK! IDLE NO MORE SUPERHEROES FOUNDERS OF IDLE NO MORE SHEELAH MCLEAN, NINA WILSON, SYLVIA MCADAM, JESSICA GORDON'.
image.caption:
Did you know that IDLE NO MORE began with these four ROCKIN’ ladies from Saskatchewan — Sheelah McLean, Nina Wilson, Sylvia McAdam & Jessica Gordon? (L to R / Photo: Marcel Petit) 
What started as a grassroots campaign opposing the federal government’s 2012 Bill C-45, IDLE NO MORE galvanized the Indigenous community, attracted supporters and allies from around the world, and grew into an inclusive movement for Indigenous rights and the protection of land, water, and sky. 
As McAdam (Big River First Nation, Treaty 6) eloquently shared in a 2017 CBC interview, the impact of IDLE NO MORE has been significant, “I don't think Canada will ever quite be the same again, because now [the government is] careful, they're thinking about Treaty, Indigenous sovereignty, nation to nation, meeting the TRC (Truth and Reconciliation Commission) recommendations, UNDRIP [United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples] — this is unheard of if you explored that landscape 10 years ago.”
Indeed Canada is not the same thanks to the courageous advocacy and peaceful activism of these women. We still have a long, long way to go in our journey toward true Truth and Reconciliation, but with incredible leaders like Sheelah McLean, Nina Wilson, Sylvia McAdam & Jessica Gordon showing the way, there’s no doubt we will get there. 🧡🪶

#MondayMotivation 
#womenempowerment #womensupportingwomen #inspiringwomen #CanadianWomenWhoRock #CWWR

image.caption: This concrete sculpture was bolted to a piece of concrete rubble near Cherry beach in 1989 Toronto. Cherry Beach was a remote part of Toronto near the ship yards in those days , and it was infamous for being the spot that rogue Police took people for harassment. #torontostreetart #torontoart #politicalart#justseeds#canadianartmagazine #idlenomore#blacklivesmatter #blogto#artandactivism

image.alt_text: Photo by Bangishimo in Waterloo Park with @cbcindigenous, @ctvlondon, @atlohsa, and @ose.kenhionhatatie.
image.caption:
Land Back Camp was supposed to be a temporary "occupation". 161 days later. We are a Two Spirit space. We are a Queer space. We are Indigenous. We are settlers. We are making change happen. Land Back Camp is honoured to be a recipient of this year's @atlohsa Peace Awards. ✊🏾🔥❤🌈
.
Photo: @therewillbeloudscreaming and Shawn J

image.alt_text: Photo by CJPME on May 26, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'SOLIDARITY AGAINST RACISM AND SETTLER-COLONIALISM! SETTLER blmcanada FREE PALESTINE IDLE NO MORE STANDS IN SOLIDARITY WITH PALESTINE Idle No More Black Lives Matter Canada and Idle No More Stand With Palestine!'.
image.caption:
Solidarity against racism and settler-colonialsm! Black Lives Matter Canada and Idle No More stand with Palestine!

Over the past couple of weeks, we have been thrilled to see important statements of solidarity with the Palestinian people from @blmcanada and @IdleNoMore. 

BLM Canada shared a post calling for "Free Palestine," and urged everyone to join the fight for justice and liberation worldwide. https://www.instagram.com/p/CO1Cy_ltHK5/

Idle No More issued a statement saying that they "stand in solidarity with Palestinian people and calls upon the Canadian and US governments, along with the United Nations to Boycott, Divest and Sanction the Israeli government for international crimes against humanity. The silence of the Canadian government on these events is complicity with genocide." 
https://www.facebook.com/IdleNoMoreCommunity/posts/1968837273279434

We know that these struggles are connected. Just as we seek an end to colonial violence and dispossession in Palestine, we also commit ourselves to fighting anti-Black racism and anti-Indigenous racism and settler-colonialism across Turtle Island. In solidarity!

#savesheikhjarrah #solidarity #freepalestine #idlenomore #blacklivesmatter #cjpme
